thread.title: Russia rejects accusations over Flynn sanctions reports - CNNPolitics.com
thread.title_full: Russia rejects accusations over Flynn sanctions reports - CNNPolitics.com

author: Maria Stromova
title: Russia rejects accusations over Flynn sanctions reports - CNNPolitics.com
text: Russia denies discussions on sanctions Kremlin says "information is incorrect" Moscow (CNN) The Kremlin has denied reports that Michael Flynn, President Donald Trump's national security adviser, discussed sanctions on Russia in recent discussions with Russia's ambassador to Washington. When asked about a Washington Post report that Flynn and Sergey Kislyak discussed US sanctions on Russia -- and that these discussions may have influenced President Vladimir Putin's decision not to retaliate to the sanctions -- Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said "the information is incorrect." "If I understand the communication between Flynn and Kislyak correctly, there have been some talks. If I understand correctly," Peskov said. "As for the rest, the information is incorrect," he added. Eavesdropping Read More Law enforcement and intelligence officials told CNN last month that calls between Flynn and Kislyak were being scrutinized by investigators as part of a broader counterintelligence investigation of Russian activities in the US. Officials stressed last month that there was no determination of any wrongdoing. The calls were captured by routine US eavesdropping targeting Russian diplomats, according to the intelligence and law enforcement officials. Maria Stromova reported from Russia. CNN's James Masters wrote from London. CNN's Evan Perez and Jim Sciutto contributed to this report. Sections
